name: Fairfield Inn Philadelphia Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times now, after long-haul flights into Philly, before continuing our journey the following day. The hotel is pretty unremarkable, but is located close to the airport (with free shuttle bus service) and staff are very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: In our experience, the prices aren't particularly cheap but breakfast is included,
reviews.title: Good place to be stuck!

reviews.text: There's a Ruby Tuesday restaurant over the road from the hotel, which is very convenient if you have not yet picked up your rental car (which we tend to do the following morning). There's also an ATM/cash-point within walking distance.
reviews.title: Good enough for a one night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was stuck here in January during an ice storm. Friendly staff who carefully handled getting all the stranded passengers to the airport in the morning. Good breakfast that thankfully was available early. Comfortable, clean room. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, great service

reviews.text: My son and I stayed here for one night before flying out of Philadelphia International Airport. We arrived late and checked into our room. No issues with check in. The hotel was secure and the lobby and staff were nice. Our room, however, had a very musty odor. I sometimes suffer from asthma and thought that the smell was going to put me into an asthma attack. I should've requested a new room, but didn't because it was so late and we needed to leave at 4am the next morning.
reviews.title: Not worth staying here.

reviews.text: I didn't arrive until about 1130pm from a flight and still had no problems. Also I think I only waited about 10 minutes for the shuttle but I called when I arrived.
reviews.title: Little worn but no problems.

reviews.text: Checkin
reviews.title: Good location, great staff

reviews.text: I was up there and to my room very fast. Plus they were training a new employee.
reviews.title: Good experience, convenient location

reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Horrible stay!

reviews.text: Yes the place is a little worn looking but I had no problems.
reviews.title: More basic than most
Nice Building, Bad Hotel Guests
reviews.text: "Noise and mayhem in the hotel rooms at all hours." That sums up my experience.

I give the facility 4 stars, housekeeping 4 stars, but hotel management 0 stars. I was here for a long weekend. I thought the airport travelers were well-behaved and mostly transparent. Some couples and large families though, staying here to attend functions or protests or youth sports tournaments were like crazy people. I was awakened all three nights of my stay by noise from an adjoining room.
reviews.title: Airport hotel

reviews.text: The location is a hidden gem if you are comfortable using the train to get to and from the central city inexpensively. I researched this long row of airport hotels ahead of time. Prices are great at all of them, this being one of the lowest. I will stay at a different one next time. The Eastwick station for the SEPTA train (it also services the airport) is a short four-block walk from here. And when it is time to leave, you don't have to worry about bad overnight weather because you are so close to the airport.
reviews.title: This should be a no go !!!!

reviews.text: Great location near PHL, Ruby Tuesday across parking lot VERY convenient for business traveler without car. Breakfast in AM very basic...wouldn't mind seeing another hot item (i.e. biscuits & gravy).
reviews.title: Basic airport hotel

reviews.text: Basic hotel room, but fit my needs as business traveler, print boarding pass in lobby area. Shuttle service but did not utilize.
reviews.title: Fairfield inn by the Phila. Airport

reviews.text: While this is an older hotel, it is well maintained, very clean, and has all the things business travellers need -- free internet, business center, continental breakfast. Staff was very pleasant. Very convenient to the airport and an easy shot to downtown. Will probably use it again.
reviews.title: Good hotel for overnight business trip

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights on a "mini-vacation" to Philly (mostly a stop on the way to a week in DC). Hotel is out near the airport, so it is about 20 minutes to get into downtown (which we knew beforehand) but overall it was still pretty convenient.
reviews.title: Yup, it's a Fairfield Inn!

reviews.text: Hotel itself is unremarkable...it is a Fairfield Inn...but I will say that in general this particular hotel is extremely clean, and the staff has all been exceptionally friendly. There is a small pool here, they keep it nice and warm, and my kids loved it. Also a Ruby Tuesday right next door for dinner. There is a bit of noise from being so close to the airport, but honestly I didn't hear anything over the air conditioner, so it didn't bother me at all!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Overall - I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: I stayed here with two friends on Sunday May 20, 2012. We were going to MMRBQ in Camden NJ and were only at the hotel for a short time before and after the concert. It was very convenient for us as we were meeting from different parts of the east coast and it was an easy ride to and from the Susquehanna Bank Center.
reviews.title: Convenient location, okay stay

aka: Fairfield Inn Philadelphia Airport Hotel Philadelphia
